sections.purpose: To provide a stable, comfortable surface for animal restraint during procedures.
sections.scope: Applicable to routine animal manipulations in pharmacology.
procedure: Place the table in a well-lit, quiet area.
Cover the table surface with clean absorbent paper or cloth.
Gently place the animal on the table.
Use appropriate restraint techniques specific to the species.
Release the animal and observe for normal behavior.
Dispose of used coverings as biohazardous waste if contaminated.
precautions: Always handle animals calmly to minimize stress.
Have two people for larger animals.
Clean and disinfect the table between uses.
Avoid sharp edges or slippery surfaces.
